dialogues.text: Daphne waits, clutching her suitcase and lets Easy lead t way. They get to the door and find it ajar.    Easy takes a lo inside and then cautiously steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks on the wall switch. It's a typical little hideaway that the rich kept for summer use. The living room, dining room, and kitchen are all in one with a long counter separating the kitchen. On the left is a wooden couch with a Mexican rug thrown across it and a metal chair with tan cushions for the sea and back. The opposite wall is all glass with the city lights blinking in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McGee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.   Easy leads them to a door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Another wall of glass and A DEAD MAN spread out on the king-sized bed, with the contents of the dresser and closet strewn all over the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gags and backs out of the room with her hand over her mouth in case she throws up. Easy takes out a handkerchief and holds it over his mouth and nose as he gets a closer look at the body. It's the drunk white man he had seen at John's Speakeasy the same blue suit. He's lying on his back like a crucifi with a butcher knife buried in his chest. There's blood that has drained from his chest and gathered around his f and hair so dark and thick you could scoop it up like Jel Easy actually does throw up and doubles over, dropping to knee to keep his balance and some control. He stays there for several moments regaining his composure and then spot spilled ashtray and a cigarette butt. He lifts it off the floor and smells it. He wipes his mouth with the handkerchief and then wraps the butt inside and puts it i his pocket. He gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears a CAR ENGINE start up and GEARS SHIFTING.     Th runs out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pink Studebaker whips backward out the driveway. Easy runs alongside trying to stop Daphne as she screeches int the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She speeds off down the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands in the middle of the street, watching her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiery orange light bounces off the hood of the car into Easy's face as he turns the corner onto his block. He is surprised to see A WHITE CADILLAC parked in front of his house.      And n his front door that's open.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO EASY
dialogues.text: He pulls in behind the Caddy and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes open the door. Shariff loiters just inside, grinning at him, and Manny stands in the middle of the living room looking at the floor. From a RADIO in another room Tommy Dorsey plays "Blue Skies" with Frank Sinatra o front. And so Easy walks past the two hoods into

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Albright turns from looking out the backyard window with porcelain coffee cup cradled in his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy looks at the coffee pot on the stove and again at Albright, smiling loose and friendly but looking tired in the same clothes he had on at the pier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you doin' in my house, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expected you to be home, so Manny used a screwdriver on the door. What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got no excuse to be breakin' into my house -- What if I broke into your place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still smiling) I'd tear your nigger head out by its root.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy boils inside and then goes over to the counter to po himself a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been this time of morning, Easy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to see a girl. Don't you get none, Mr. Albright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smile leaves Albright's face and his eyes turn even colder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't come here to play, boy. You got my money in your pocket and we've been over at that address waitin' all night for Frank Green and now we've found out that he moved from there over a year ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy is scared and confused but he plays it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want me to do about it? You don't think I did my job. Shit, I give you the money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he reaches for his pocket, but Albright reaches too - and suddenly, Manny and Shariff are in the room and on Ea like a vice. Albright presses the barrel of the .45 again Easy's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe in God, Easy? 'Cause I'm curious to see if death is any different for a religious man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy looks down, away from the gun, and swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, everyone relaxes and Easy sags out from under their grip and staggers into

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Manny and Shariff surround him as he sits down in a chair and Albright stalks in holstering his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She called me. Had me drive up to the Hollywood Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd she know about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess Coretta... the girl that told me about Daphne and Frank Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't. She threatened to tell the cops that I had killed Coretta...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albright looks over at his henchmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She took off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dangerously) Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! While I was looking at the body she split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Uh-hunh.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Albright looks around the room as if answers lie in the corners, but he is not surprised to hear about a body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call the cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried my best to keep in the speed limit. That's all I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd she do, take his car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McGee.   Did she take his car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy hesitates, "How did Albright know his name?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you pick her up at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She left that place--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Write it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To his shame Easy flinches and gets paper from his end table, then scribbles down the address and hands it to Albright who takes Easy's seat and examines the note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me some whiskey, Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy studies Albright who sits knees wide apart, now the master of the house, and he can't help himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it yourself... Bottle's in the cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albright looks up and Easy braces himself for Albright to bring on the end, all at once. But slowly a smile spreads across Albright's face and he laughs, stamping his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be damned. Get us a drink, Manny... Easy, you're a brave man. I need a brave man working for me... But you gotta find Frank Green, so he can lead us to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks, Mr. Albright. People are gettin' killed all around me... You never said anything about all this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, you're connectable to two murders. You'll do whatever I tell you to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny brings Albright's drink and the captain turns it up and gives Manny back the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now you got three days to find him. And you make sure you count 'em right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out the screen door with Manny and Shariff following.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Easy grabs the bottle from the counter, where Manny has l it, and pours himself a stiff one. But he only stares int the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dense black smoke masks everything but two vague figures a struggle. The BOOM of heavy artillery gives way only to the deafening CHATTER of automatic fire. We are hurtling forward into a horror-stricken Easy in combat gear, repeatedly stabbing an already lifeless Germ soldier. Tears are streaming down Easy's face, his mouth gaped open in an inaudible SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: He studies the glass and pushes it away.   Then looks

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Albright and his two goons get in the white Caddy and cru away.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: He dials the operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed help... Albright didn't flinch at hearing that Coretta was dead and he seemed to know all about Richard McGee too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raymond Alexander on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, speechless as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Forget about it, operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, his eyes trained in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd has gathered along the street to watch a three convertible car caravan: the first car bearing a four-pla band playing "Happy Days Are Here Again"; the second with someone who could be Lana Turner holding up a "Teran for Mayor" placard with a man in the front passenger seat announcing through a megaphone; and last, but hardly leas Matthew Teran blowing kisses and waving two small America flags. Easy looks up for a moment as he closes the trunk of his to watch the parade. Then stuffs a ball peen hammer in th waistband at the small of his back, under his jacket. He walks with a purpose into the open door next to the butcher shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy stops in the doorway, seeing JOPPY as usual buffing the marble top of his bar. T-Bone Walker's "They Call It Stormy Monday" is on the jukebox.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO EASY
dialogues.text: He scans the bar and sees that there are no customers, an walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy stops at the bar and stares at Joppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That girl called me last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What girl is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one your friend is lookin' for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, huh.   That's pretty lucky, hunh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Joppy... Wasn't no luck at all. It was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joppy inadvertently clenches his fists and notices Easy's aggressive stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Coretta was the only ones that had my phone number who knew I was lookin' for her. And Coretta was busy scammin' Daphne so she wouldn't have done it... It was you, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she looked in the phone book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't in the phone book, Joppy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joppy's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you mean, coming up here all mad like you gonna do something?!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) You damn right! Coretta's dead! Your friend Albright is on my ass. The cops done brought me down once -- Why didn't you just tell Albright your damn self?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling back) What did I tell you? To just take that man's money! I didn't tell you to do nothin'! I call myself trying to help you save your house... Don't come up in here startin' no shit with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he pulls a baseball bat from behind the bar, but Easy has pulled his hammer and SMACKS it down hard, cracking t beveled wood that frames the marble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; panicked) Easy, wait! Watch my marble! My uncle left me that when he died!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And goddammit, he's about to get it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws back for the downswing, and Joppy drops the baseball bat, holding up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk.   Let's just talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got me into, Joppy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joppy inhales, forcing himself to be calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She asked me to help her 'cause I told her that Albright was lookin' for her. And I figured I could help you make a few bucks and throw Albright off the trail too. She wanted to know something about you so I told her... I guess I must've give her your phone number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me, Joppy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't lyin'... I don't even know her that good. She just asked me to help her. And she asked me not to tell nobody... I guess 'cause of her and Frank Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she runnin' from Joppy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear I don't know. She didn't tell me. I didn't mean to get you into nothin', Easy... I just... she just... I mean you seen her, Easy... Man, she's something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy can see "sucker" written all over Joppy as he fumble for a cigarette with one hand and shakes his head with disgust as he lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, Joppy. Is there any white woman that ever gave you the time of day that you wasn't a sucker for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joppy frowns painfully and continues to wipe the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy turns into the winding driveway through the stone entrance way that bears the name of this distinguished institution on a bronze plate. He parks the car and gets   out, adjusting his dark brown Stetson which matches his   pin-stripped suit. He looks around at the massive and   well manicured grounds and wa into a patio area of this   Spanish-style complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albright had said that when you're mixed up in something it's best to be mixed up to the top. I could see his point. So that's where I was going... all the way to the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ELDERLY SECRETARY descends an outdoor curved stairway carrying a file. She spots Easy looking around confused a immediately becomes annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... yes.   I came to see Mr. Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sorry, but Mr. Carter is a very busy man. Easy pulls out Albright's business card and hands it to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, tell him Mr. Albright sent me, and it's real important. She looks at the card and then up at Easy with annoyed superiority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask the nature of your call, Mister...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rawlins. But I'm not so sure he'd want me to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm quite sure, Mr. Rawlins, that whatever you know is nothing I can't know as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Well, anyway, tell him I'm here with information about that little chippy of his that dumped him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this some sort of joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Easy and the secretary turn to see a TALL MAN in a dark g suit with bushy black hair and thick eyebrows standing in the doorway. He forces a smile and comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Rawlins was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out his hand and Easy shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Mister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baxter. (to the secretary) I'll take care of this. (and back to Easy) Why don't you come with me, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the door into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not very smart talking about Mr. Carter's business to a secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna hear it, man. It's too much goin' on for me to give a damn about what you think is smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baxter bristles up and slows down his walk, about to put Easy in his place. But Easy slows down too and squares up on him. Baxter reconsiders and leads the way up a stone staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baxter ushers Easy into a huge elegantly furnished room m closely resembling a hall than an office with large arche doors and windows leading out onto a stone veranda overlooking a canyon. Alone looking out at the greenery on the opposite hillsid is TODD CARTER. Baxter walks out and speaks with Carter, while Easy watch them from inside the office. The rich man perks up with interest and hurries inside with Baxter who throws Easy a dirty look on his way out. He pauses uncertainly wearing simple Sears Roebuck-looking tan suit with a plain open- collared white shirt. The dark circles under his eyes sho nights without sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Rawlins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs a hand through his thinning red hair, and offers overstuffed sofa. They sit on either end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught) Has something happened to Daphne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last time I saw her she looked fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still in town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she say -- what was she wearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blue dress.    Blue heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a pin on her chest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, on the left side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carried away) Oh yes, that's her. That's her. You know I've never known a woman who could wear perfume so slight that--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Mr. Carter, Mr. Carter--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she say? What did she say?... Oh, I'm sorry. Brandy?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He points to a crystal decanter near Easy. Easy pours himself a drink and takes in Carter as he wrings his hand to keep from going to pieces. This guy's got it bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Carter. I came here to get some answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I'm takin' a helluva chance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter runs his hand through his hair again, the suspense killing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I guess it's just that when I'm working for somebody, I wanna know what I'm gettin' myself into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter leans in as if he missed something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd like to know the real reason why Mr. Albright hired me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Mr. Albright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The man you hired to find Daphne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be some mistake... I'm sorry, busy... Who are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy and Carter stare at each other, not sure how to proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't hire somebody to find your girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Until just now I was sure that she was hundreds of miles away from here... You say someone is looking for her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy nods, his brow furrowed in thought. Carter gets up a walks to the door, looking out into the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half to himself) Someone is looking for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on between you two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter shrugs and stammers nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... I don't know... We were going to be married... We had a fight... (then recovering) Uh... that's none of your concern, Mr. Rawlins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and looks to the floor, the gravity pulling him down... way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Someone's... after her? A Mr. Albright? And he said he's working for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Do you know a man named Richard McGee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I can't say that I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would someone be after her, Mr. Carter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... I can't say -- I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying and Easy knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Do you think you could find her again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important, Mr. Rawlins, for her sake... I'm willing to pay you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Carter, why did she leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you any more Mr. Rawlins -- I'll pay you to find her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy thinks about it, and then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... a thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand dollars?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I'll take two hundred right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Rawlins. I think you're trying to take advantage of me. But left me inform you that the incumbent mayor and the chief of police eat at my house regularly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Then they can help us--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --No.   They can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is too emphatic and Easy waits for him to give mor but instead he turns and gazes out again at the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have Baxter write you out a check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Mr. Carter, why'd you stop runnin' for mayor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terse) I'll have Baxter write you a check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is Matthew Teran looking for her too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with finality) Baxter will write you a check!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy takes him in and then holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take cash, Mr. Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter fumbles in his wallet, and too nervous to count th money, shoves the wallet at Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it all... Just take it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy nods and strides out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy walks to his car, gets in and drives away toward the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Albright was working for Matthew Teran. And whatever Teran had on Carter was strong stuff... too strong even for Carter to go to the police... But because Teran was desperate to find the girl too, that gave me the best hand. I had seen her once, and if I played it right, I'd see her again.

dialogues.speaker: POOL HALL
dialogues.text: Easy talks to the short, squat, suspicious woman who runs the place. Through the smoke, other distrustful eyes fix him from pool tables and dark corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everywhere I went was a familiar place, but different because I was asking about buying hijacked liquor from the man nobody wanted to talk about. Frank Green...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTCLUB
dialogues.text: Upscale, with a balcony. Billy Eckstine fronts the band. Blacks and whites are dressed to impress, including Easy, who leans into the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was actually looking more and more like I might not make it through this little adventure I was having. But I was likin' the chill in my blood, and the freedom of working on my own.

dialogues.speaker: ABE AND JOHNNY'S LIQUOR
dialogues.text: The two JEWISH OWNERS unveil for Easy a case of hijacked liquor in a wooden crate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were times in the war when I had felt like this. When life or death where the only two choices. That made it simple. And that was alright by me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy unlatches the gate and pushes it open. He's tired, a he trudges up the walkway to the porch. He sees THE WOODCUTTER standing on the front lawn of the next doo neighbor's, waving at him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO EASY
dialogues.text: He throws a rock and then unlocks the door. But he notice THE POT OF AFRICAN VIOLETS lying broken on the cement. He looks up just in time to see a TWO-BY-FOUR swing down. BONK! And Easy is seeing stars. A big man, dressed in black, kicks open the door and driv Easy head first into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy slams to the floor but manages to roll out of the wa of a lethal CRACK! of the board onto the floor. He grabs a lamp and hurls it at the oncoming figure who catches it on the arm and keeps on coming, snapping a bla from his fist which leaps out like a chrome-colored flame Easy scrambles back, his head butting up against the couc his forehead streaming blood, his eyes wide with the sigh of sure death advancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) Frank! Wait a minute!   I need to talk to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looms over him, his   sinister but handsome brown f framed by a short-rimmed,   black Stetson hat and a black shirt and coat. He holds    the knife to Easy's neck, let blade press into the skin   as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the reason why she told me to lay low, hunh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy buries himself back against the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (machine gun quick) Naw. I got five hundred dollars for you. Rich man wants to talk to a white girl you know. Daphne...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's eyes flame and he presses the knife, drawing bloo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a dead man--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, you in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's head whips toward the door and Easy knocks the kn away and comes up tussling. Frank scrambles to get away and Easy tackles him, straini to keep Frank from reaching the knife. THE FRONT DOOR springs open and SPATS ON PATENT LEATHER SHOES clump in, the last one stomping down on Frank's outstretched fingers. Frank screams and cradles his hand agony. Easy scrambles up to his knees and gawks up at MOUSE, dressed in a plaid zoot suit with Broadway suspend down the front of his shirt, a long-barreled .41 caliber pistol held loosely in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhaling relief) Mouse! Aw, man naw, it's all right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's happenin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out his hand and helps Easy to his feet. Frank makes a slight move towards the knife and Mouse lev the pistol at his head, his gold-rimmed teeth glittering from a smile that wants Frank to go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll blow your goddamned nose off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't! (to Frank) Where's Daphne Monet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank just stares up at Easy, his eyes sharp and defiant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if you don't know where she is, maybe we can help each other find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Mouse cocks the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigga, you heard him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mouse.    Don't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS next to Mouse and he picks it up, eyes st on Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?... He's busy right now, you gonna have to call back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, a rich man she knows is willing to pay a thousand dollars just to talk to her. A thousand bucks, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank still won't talk and that does it for Mouse.   He releases the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, lemme try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNK!   He slaps Frank upside the head with the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better... (THUNK!) Talk... (THUNK!) You stupid--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy grabs Mouse's arm and Frank slumps to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two friends struggle, and Frank rears up and plows in Easy, sending him sprawling to the floor on top of Mouse. Then Frank, covered in blood, hurls himself across the ro out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81   Mouse gets to his feet and runs to the door aiming t pistol, but it's too late. Easy stands up and Mouse point gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you, Easy. Don't you never grab me when I got a gun in my hand! Easy silently eyes the pistol and gives Mouse a chance to calm down. After a moment Mouse looks down at his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the blood you done got on my coat. Why you wanna go and do that? He looks out the door and grabs a small suitcase. Then spots the bathroom and moves to it, taking off his jacket and hanging the pistol in his belt. Easy holds his fingers to the bump on his forehead and catches his breath as Mouse runs water in the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we got to find that girl so we can get that money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we don't, Mouse. I don't need your kinda help or I would've called you. Mouse comes out of the bathroom, scrubbing at a spot on h jacket with a washcloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You standing there with a knot on your head the size of a twelve- year-old tittie and you "don't need my kind of help"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the same shit you pulled five years ago when you asked me to drive you out to your stepfather's house, then come to find out you killed him and your stepbrother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, easy, that was a long time ago. Easy glares at Mouse and dabs blood from his forehead wit handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Come on, Easy. Cut me in on this. I could help you. I let you run the show. I swear I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ambles over to Easy apologetically and holds Easy's shoulders with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, I ain't gonna do nothin' you don't tell me to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy knows he can't believe this but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With no choice, Easy nods and walks into

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: He runs cold water onto a washcloth and looks in the mirr dabbing at his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Sound like some white girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy turns toward the door "Aw Man!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse, in a plum colored double-breasted suit and a brown felt derby hat, turns on the radio and the Ink Spots' "We Meet Again" purrs out. He starts to turn the key, but the remembers and honks the horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy opens the door and stands on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Easy, was it a left on Richland or a right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A right. And if Dupree ain't over there in Compton, just come on back 'cause I might have heard from the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a car cruises around the corner and Easy watche MASON AND MILLER pull up across the street and get out. H glances over at Mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse shuts off the radio and slumps down in the seat out view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy watches them stroll up the walkway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Rawlins... We came to ask you a few more questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) So why don't you just invite us inside... (holding open the door) After you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Easy and Miller go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your head? I don't remember doing all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs and closes the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller looks around suspiciously. The room still shows signs of the struggle with Frank Green. He exchanges a lo with Mason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been having a party, Ezekiel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason pushes Easy into the chair and Miller plants his fo on the seat between Easy's legs and leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a lotta cuts and bruises to be an ordinary working stiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's looking worse and worse for you, my friend. What do you know about Richard McGee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the room Mason picks up a chunk of t broken lamp from the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dead white man in a cabin in Laurel Canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason comes over and stands over Easy next to his partner He fingers the sharp porcelain shard of the lamp, threatening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs out with some of those same nigger friends of yours down on Central Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy eyes the sharp edge, making up his mind to kill this fat son-of-a-bitch if he gets too creative, and die with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just happened to have a note in his pocket with 'C. James' written on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the slip of paper up for Easy to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any of this making you feel talkative at all, 'cause I'll bet ya six bits to a bottle of piss that we're looking at a double here... All we need is to place you in the dead man's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't been in no dead man's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller stands back and pats his pockets for a smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout a smoke, Ezekiel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy taps out one and Miller places it in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy pulls out his lighter and sparks the flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy shrugs and passes the lighter to Miller who fires himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice lighter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the lighter out of Mason who wraps it up in a handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we got our print.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hadn't you heard? We found a cigarette lighter in the dead man's house with the killer's fingerprints on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (total disbelief) Naw, man. I didn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course you did, we got evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) I didn't do it. You know I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Miller leans in hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know that you know more than you're lettin' on. And now a white man's been killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you better tell us what you know, or you're goin' down for the murder of Richard McGee and Coretta James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He straightens up and Easy stands up, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) I don't know nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mason) Put the cuffs on. Let's take him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mason reaches for the cuffs, Easy sees Mouse peek out from the kitchen doorway then disappear inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, listen!    I don't know who did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Mouse draw his gun, his eyes trained on Miller's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's all that counts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, I didn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell it to the D.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse is trained with the hammer cocked and Easy is about give the signal, but then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, gimme some time to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme till tomorrow... Tomorrow mornin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller thinks about it and then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Tomorrow morning, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to Mason and Easy looks up to see Mouse raise the gun and slide back into the kitchen. Mason unlocks the cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice evening, Ezekiel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he and Miller walk out. Easy looks out the doorway watching

dialogues.speaker: MILLER AND MASON
dialogues.text: get in their squad car and drive away.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: B88   He turns back to see Mouse standing in the living r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily) I guess you know what would have happened if you had shot them two cops in my house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Hell yeah. They'd be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy hurries out of his house pulling on his jacket with Mouse right behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What they tryin' to pin on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you on the way.   You got the keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he hurries around to the driver's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we run out to Compton we got one other place to stop by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He freezes seeing the Woodcutter watching and listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Woodcutter) Man, don't you mess with my trees while I'm gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets in as Mouse cranks the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.   Leave my trees alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mouse starts away the old man smiles mischievously and starts to sharpen his axe. Easy leans out the car window, yelling back as the car pu away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it now. Don't you mess with my trees!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a horseshoe of tiny apartments with over a dozen lit porches and doorways staggered in a semi-circle around a small yard that has a half-dozen stunted magnolia trees growing in brick pots. Easy and Mouse step into the courtyard, passing elderly tenants sitting inside screened doors. Jimmy Lunceford's "I'm Walking Through Heaven With You" floats out into the yard. They arrive at the closed door of number eight. Easy knoc and then knocks again, hard. Something CRASHES on the inside and heavy FOOTSTEPS pound to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and JUNIOR FORNAY stands there behind the screen door in blue boxer shorts and a white T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's private, Junior.   Lemme in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he reaches to pull open the door, but Junior throws t latch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't got time now.   I'm tryin' to get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you open the door, Junior, 'fore I have to shoot it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse steps out into the doorway, in plain view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up.   We ain't got all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior forces a smile and lets them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filthy and junky, with old car parts scattered amongst ol furniture, the room is unpleasant with only the benefit o dim light -- just like Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all want a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods at a card table with one folding chair and throws two others into place on his way to the refrigerator. Easy and Mouse sit down and Junior brings over a quart of PABST BLUE RIBBON BEER and two glasses that he wipes out with a rag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ya smokin'? Zapatas?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Junior tosses his pack onto the table and pours beer into the glasses for Easy and Mouse, and drinks from the bottl Easy unfolds the handkerchief in his pocket on the table, uncovering the cigarette butt from Richard McGee's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Junior) This is one of yours, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior looks at the butt and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the only one I know cheap enough to smoke this shit... Why'd you kill Richard McGee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?   What you talkin' 'bout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't no time to play, Junior.    I know you the one killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy, man. You crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he stands up to emphasize his indignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior shifts awkwardly from side to side and then sits b down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what happened, Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you talkin' 'bout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the police will. When they find out that they got your fingerprints up there in that man's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What fingerprints? What house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hattie had you pull that man out of John's the night I was there. And he was laying up there dead with the same suit on and a knife in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't killed nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit lyin', you big ole sweaty- thick headed-cornbread eatin'--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse can't keep from laughing and Junior starts up after Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thick-headed, ya damn self!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mouse is up, still laughing with the pistol in his ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, man... 'fore I blow your brains out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda shit y'all trying to pull here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (last warning) Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior sits down and throws himself around in the chair l a child throwing a fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better tell it the way it happened. And maybe I'll forget what I know... Otherwise, I'm gonna tell Mouse to shoot ya 'cause you know I don't like your ass and he don't like you either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse slaps the table, laughing so hard he's in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he aims the pistol and cocks the hammer, causing Juni to throw himself around some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him to take his money, didn't ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know who you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just had to rob him, didn't ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't! I didn't touch nothin' in his house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. But it's in the open now and Junior frowns and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hattie had me take him out to his car. And he say he give me ten dollars to drive him home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse is busy working a toothpick between his front teeth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you took that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah. Then he asked me about that white girl you was askin' everybody about at the club. And I told him I seen her with Coretta... What the hell I care if he know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell him but you won't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like your ass, Easy.   And he gimme fifty dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelievingly) Fifty dollars? Just to tell him you seen her with Coretta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw.   To deliver a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy is stopped for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What letter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I know? He just said to give it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you knew where she was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that! I give it to Coretta to give it to her the next mornin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You 'spect me to believe that? Why would he trust you to give it to the girl if it was worth fifty dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause he had to blow town, fool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy stops to make the connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) You better be tellin' the truth. Let's go, Raymond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Mouse get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' the truth. I ain't killed nobody. That man was alive when I left him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy opens the door, looking back at Junior, who's still going on and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compton looks a lot like Texas, with unpaved streets and little country-styled houses set back away from the road behind vegetable gardens and chicken coops and small shed with a horse or a cow tied up.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Easy and Mouse pull into    the gravel driveway of a litt house and are met by the    usual barking dog you find in country -- part Spaniel,    part Shepherd, and some kind Retriever. It dogs Easy     and Mouse's heels as they get of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They notice the light in the front window go out and the shade pull back slightly as they walk toward the front do Moments later the door opens and the dark figure of Dupre Brouchard appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the dog) Go on. Go on in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog obeys and Easy and Mouse walk up the walkway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dupree.    Been trying to call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Easy! Cops just let me out today. My sister gone to work and I didn't feel much like talking... Raymond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, big man!    Them pigtails I smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Lula Mae made some 'fore she went to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupree ushers them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupree's face under the kitchen light shows two swollen black eyes from a brutal police "questioning." His eyes a heavy with liquor and tears glisten down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why somebody wanna kill her like that? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Dupree... I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dupree pours rye whiskey into a water glass in front of Mouse, who swallows half the shot without looking up from his plate of food. Easy declines when the bottle comes his way, feeling the pressure of time running out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Coretta ever say anything to you about a letter she was keeping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letter?   What kinda letter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For that white girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. But I know it was on account of her that Coretta got killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy rears back in his chair with keen interest and Mouse looks up from his pigtails. Dupree takes a drink and his eyes narrow in anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Everything between Coretta and that Daphne was always such a damn secret... I mean that ole girl didn't think nothin' about two- timin' on Frank... She probably 'innerduced' Coretta to one of them ole guys she knew... And when he came to the house after Coretta... (starting to break) ...he found out she wasn't that kinda woman... Cops said she fought him... aw my Gawd... fought him 'cause she wouldn't have nobody but me-e-e...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He buries his face into his hands and Easy throws a sad b frustrated look to Mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Aw Gawd, I can't even go to sleep... 'cause I can still see her face that mornin' 'fore I went to work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior had been by and just left the house... and she came runnin' out to the car carrying her bible... And she said, 'Keep this for me, baby.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy and Mouse exchange looks.   JACKPOT!   And Dupree fa apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Police won't even let me go near her house. So it's the only thing I got left from her. It was a sign... I know it was a sign, 'cause she was so religious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, big man... it's all right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he pours Dupree a half glass of rye.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOTTLE
dialogues.text: Barely a "corner" of whiskey lies at the bottom and DUPREE is snoring like a buzzsaw, sound asleep. MOUSE squints into his glass, wondering why it's empty, a looks down the length of the kitchen leading into

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Drawers are pulled out on the dresser, and Easy is riflin through another until he pulls out a bible. He fans the pages, finding

dialogues.speaker: THE LETTER
dialogues.text: already opened.    His fingers pull out a photograph and two more.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO EASY
dialogues.text: His excited face goes sick, and he silently mouths:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shi-it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was as nauseated from fear as I was from what I saw... Pictures of a much younger Matthew Teran and children... innocent, helpless, naked children...

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Easy hurries in holding up the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. Come on, I think that girl is gonna call again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Dupree is a good man, but he sure can't hold his liquor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy grabs his coat off a chair and starts to put it on, stuffing the letter in his coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got your sails up pretty far too, Raymond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You callin' me drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you been puttin' it away along with him and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was drunk could I do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in less than a heartbeat he has pulled that long- barreled pistol and is aiming it at Easy's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't a man in Texas can outdraw me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forced calm) Put it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he puts the gun back in his shoulder holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for your gun. Let's see who gets kilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a gun, Raymond.   Come on, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fool enough to go without a piece then you must wanna be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lays the pistol on the table then draws a .32 automati from his waist, this time cocking the hammer, the muzzle only inches from Easy's head. Easy can tell from the glazed look in Mouse's eye that instead of seeing him, his friend is glaring at some demo he carries around in his head. So he stands stock still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet, soothing) Let him go, Raymond... He done learned his lesson. If you kill him then he won't have got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fool enough to call me out and he ain't even got no gun? I'll kill the motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him live, Raymond, and he be scared whenever you walk in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker better be scared. I kill a motherfucker. I kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy stares down the barrel of the gun for a long moment until Mouse blinks, then nods and lets the pistol fall do into his lap. His head on his chest, he's sound asleep. Easy takes the gun and puts it on the table with the othe Then walks to the doorway and turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dim street lamps of Easy's neighborhood streak past a Easy scans the streets and sidewalks, wary for anybody wh might be staking him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pictures were burnin' a hole in my pocket... I had no doubt that Albright had killed McGee... and that he had done it for Matthew Teran... But Teran hadn't known who killed Coretta. I was sure of that, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy's car pulls up and he gets out and looks around cautiously before starting up the walkway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) For the first time I hated walking up to my house... I still didn't know if I could go to the police. But Albright was liable to be showing up in a few hours asking about Frank Green. I was thinking I oughta forget the girl and leave town, back to Houston or Galveston where they didn't know me too good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy gets to the door, still literally looking over his shoulder, and hears the phone RINGING inside. He unlocks the door and bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He races through the dark living room and into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And picks up the phone but the dial tone DRONES on the ot end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!   Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whacks the nightstand with the receiver, dying with frustration. And SOMETHING MOVES in the dark. He lunges and grabs

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE MONET
dialogues.text: and pulls her into the light, then sits down onto the bed before the shock can knock him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Easy shakes his head in disbelieving relief and she reach to touch the bump on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boyfriend, Frank Green, threw a surprise party for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Easy, Coretta's boyfriend, Dupree, got out of jail today. And... DAPHNE                          EASY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)                    (he joins her) I need you to help me           You need me to help you find him.                       find him. Easy shakes his head, amused, and lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I already have the pictures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne stiffens, as if from an electrical shock, and then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, I paid seven thousand dollars for those pictures. They belong to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Matthew Teran may have somethin' to say about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, you wouldn't dare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me.   Who killed Coretta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- I'll pay you for them. I'll give you a thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave Richard seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll give you seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get seven thousand dollars from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. I'll give it to you. Easy, please. They're very important to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coretta's life was important to a few people too. What's say you tell me who killed her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, honey, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Honey?' Do Frank and Carter really fall for that stuff? Come on... You and Todd Carter have a fight and all of a sudden he doesn't wanna be mayor no more... You leave, he's worried but he can't even get his buddies in the police department to help him find you... And now you wanna buy some pictures of Teran. Why? 'Cause he's got some dirt on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, why don't you just take the money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what Frank told Coretta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whirls around to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Was she being too nosy? Or was she just being Coretta and trying to bargain up the price?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, please.  How much do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me. Is Frank your husband or your pimp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMACK! She swings and open hand across his face, and SMAC He returns the gesture, sending her back onto the bed... He picks up the phone and dials "O."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, put the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you try screaming again? 'Cause I bet police like white women with Negro boyfriends who hijack trucks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for the phone and he pushes her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet they like pimps, and whores, too, who scam rich white men like Carter runnin' for mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, please, put it down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm sure they like it when these white girls tell their colored men to lay low 'cause they killed a woman over some pictures of another rich white man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gathers herself, just as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soberly) Frank is my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy is about to speak, but then stands still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She looks away, worn out, tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have different fathers. Mine is white... Frank doesn't even know that Todd and I broke up. So far I've kept him out of all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and takes Easy's cigarettes and taps one out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, Coretta's the only one out here in L.A. besides my brother who knew about me... (she lights up) And about a month ago she took a job working for, of all people, Matthew Teran. She made friends with one of the girls in the office who told her that she'd heard that Teran was a pedophile. And Coretta got carried away and told her that Todd Carter was engaged to a colored woman. She was sorry and didn't think it would get to Teran... but it did and he got a hold of my birth records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who killed her, Daphne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne exhales smoke and brushes hair out of her face ignoring the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Todd and I broke up and I paid a guy for the pictures of Teran. But somehow Coretta got them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who killed her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident. Coretta and I were still mad at each other. I mean, she threatened to sell Teran the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who killed her goddammit!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just asked Joppy to go over and put a scare in her... It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joppy points a finger in Coretta's face, backing her agai the counter. She grabs a knife from a rack of dishes left out to dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joppy said she pulled a knife and tried to dump hot water on him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swipes at Joppy and he backhands her against the stove... She struggles to grab a pot of boiling water, bu he wrests it from her and slings her across the room agai the counter, her head striking the tile on the way down.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Daphne looks down at her hands. She stubs out her cigarette and sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I didn't mean to hurt anybody... It's just that with the pictures I can--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Marry Carter?   Be white again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't judge me, Easy! Do you think I like pretending that I'm someone else? Do you know how I've been treated by people, colored and white, when I've tried to live as a colored woman in a colored community. Do you have any idea what any colored man whose ever been with me has had to go through? Don't you dare judge me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Easy hesitate and she stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come on, Easy. Help me.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She moves in close, caressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come on, you know it's the right thing to do... You know if things were different what would happen between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what can happen between us. You get Carter to clear me up from all this and you can have your pictures. That's all that could have ever happened between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely hurt) Sure, baby. Of course, sweetheart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the front door pushing open startles them, a Albright knocks on his way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'll be damned. You found her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Manny and Shariff step in, too, carrying baseball bat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, Albright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne breaks for the back way and Easy tries to bar Shar from going after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny swings the baseball bat into Easy's side. and Easy yells and plows into him, wrestling him against the wall. Albright grabs Easy from behind and pries him free enough for Manny to uppercut him to the chin with the fat end of the bat. Easy sinks to his knees seeing double. Shariff leads Daphne back into the room, her face contort into tears, her arm twisted up behind her in a hammerlock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Daphne) Where are the pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMACK!   He backhands her. Easy grabs for the wall to get to his feet and Manny swin the bat down into his kidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Easy) I wouldn't tell him! And I won't tell you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you will. (to Shariff) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shariff leads Daphne outside and Manny draws his forty-fi automatic and trains it on Easy, cocking the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin'? Who are we gonna give 'em to cover this shit, hunh?... Use your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves Manny through the door and pushes Easy onto his side with his foot and he's out the door. Easy strains to get back to his knees as car doors slam a the sound of a car engine growls to life. He thrusts himself up from the floor and stumbles toward front door like a boxer who should have stayed down for t count. He gets it open in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blurred white form of Albright's Caddy screaming away shattering the dark, shrieking in flight. Dogs are barking and a baby is screaming somewhere in the neighborhood while lights are going on up and down the block. Easy stumbles back inside and into

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Where he manages to dial the phone.      It RINGS several on the other end, and finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Easy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurring) Get Dupree's car. Drive it to 78th and Central... The butcher shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts down the receiver, missing the cradle, and stagge out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy is ripping through the night, the streetlights flash by in blurs of light. The windows down, he's coming to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It had come to me in less time than it takes to think that Albright was taking Daphne someplace more isolated than that office building downtown... Someplace where there would be no witnesses... And I was being left alive to take the fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is still alive. A couple of late night juke joints are coughing up the last drunken bits of the party onto the sidewalk to straggle home. Easy's car screams around the corner, and then skids in, sending a heavy-hip young sister, about to cross the street, scrambling for cover. He jumps out just as Mouse scorches the tires on Dupree's '38 Packard in behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the woman) Sorry, baby... Lemme give you twenty bucks for them stockings you got on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a moment to register, but when she sees him pull a twenty from his pocket, she gets busy. He runs back to Mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme one of them guns you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse smiles, loving this side of Easy, and trades him a of car keys for a .32 automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Start up my car. I'm comin' out fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs back to the woman he almost hit and hands off the twenty, grabbing one of the nylons, leaving her still stripping as he runs into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the steps two at a time, pulling the stocking do over his face as he reaches the top and bursts through th open door leading into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He charges through the raucous laughter of the half-full room right up to the bar. Joppy nearly drops the glasses he is clearing away as he looks down the barrel of the pistol aimed at his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Joppy. Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joppy hesitates, recognizing the voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.  I'll blow your head off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he cocks the hammer, causing Joppy to get a move on f behind the bar. Easy shoves him through the door, calling back to the startled crowd on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't follow me, goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy hides the piece in his coat pocket as he bum rushes Joppy to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, what the hell you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he shoves Joppy into the back seat, getting in next t him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive this damn thing, Mouse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse pulls off, around the corner, down the street into alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse pulls to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joppy) Albright's got the girl. He's gonna kill her. Where would he take her? And you better get it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I don't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming, pressing the gun) Don't fool with me, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a cabin out in Malibu on Route 9...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make a right, Mouse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car roars down the alley and turns right onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joppy) You sure 'bout this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so. He's done this kinda thing out there before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, what's done got into you? Thought y'all was friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed Dupree's girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lyin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he pulls out his pistol, aiming it back over the seat Joppy as he drives. KABLAAM! The bullet slams through the rear window just to the side of Joppy's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse!   What're you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABLAAM! This one digs out a chunk of upholstery between Joppy and Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   Watch out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car screeches to a halt and Mouse tries to aim again. But Easy struggles with Mouse's gun hand still holding a pistol on Joppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse, we need him to lead the way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABLAAM!   This one rips through the roof. Joppy's yelling, afraid that Easy's gun will go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse, the girl offered me seven thousand dollars for the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse glares into the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lyin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I swear I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he fumbles with the ignition and shifts gears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!... Oh, my goodness!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine roars from a punch to the accelerator, and Mouse's voice can be heard cutting through the darkness a the car powers off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my goodness!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, with the gun on Joppy, strains to see the dimly lit road in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: The headlights bounce off a signpost: "Route 9."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pontiac makes the turn onto a graded dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ranch-style cabin emerges up off the road, drawing near in the headlight beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut off the headlights, Mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse kills the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw.   It's farther up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much farther?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another ten minutes, I guess. Easy, I swear, I ain't done nothin' to nobody. I swear, I ain't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD:    House lights show through thic shrubbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse pulls to a stop and kills the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some rope in the trunk, Raymond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse gets out of the car and is heard opening the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, come on, man. That girl is lying if she told you I killed them folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said she told me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
