dialogues.text: SCREAM! It's muted and distant.     But it's a woman all right. SCREAM! Easy pushes out of the back door on the right as Mouse op the opposite door on the driver's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff this in his mouth.    I gotta get up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses Mouse the stocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the run) No, Mouse. And they'll hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabin draws nearer as Easy scrambles up the hill. He can hear Daphne crying out something, but he can't make o the words. It quiets down as he nears and sees shadows crossing a window with the shade pulled down. He moves cautiously, quietly to the window and peers thro the crack between the shade and the windowsill. He can ma out a sliver of what looks like a large room with a low ceiling. SMACK! And Daphne screams again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, talk to me. Talk to me while you still can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing) Please! I don't have them!     Easy has them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy can barely make out Shariff passing the window.   He strains to see more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said he didn't know anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was lying!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Grab that for me, Shariff. It's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then SCRE-E-EAM!! The kind that drops the bottom out your stomach. The kind more akin to fear than the word itself... The kind that fries your skin with the cold chi of horror. S-C-R-E-EAMS again!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-o-o-o!   Please. No-o-o!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now talk to me, goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-o-o!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 124   Easy's gotta make a move. KABLANGALANGLE! He smashe window with the gun and the shade rattles all the way up. Manny looks right up at his face as Daphne arches and flails, trying to get free from his hands that are pinnin her down on a battered old sofa. Albright is holding a glowing red poker that Shariff, standing in front of the fireplace, has just handed him. Easy starts blasting.   KABLAAM!   Manny takes one to the throat. KABLAAM! Albright and Shariff lunge for cover, and Daphne ducks do behind the back of the sofa, screaming and screaming. Manny, hand to his throat, pulls his gun on reflex, firin into the floor and then half runs, half staggers out the side door just ahead of another KABLAAM! that digs out a chunk of the wall. Easy hears the screen door open and then ducks down, gett ready for Manny who should be coming his way from the sid door. He HEARS more steps stumble out and then... SILENCE And then, KABLAAM! BLAAM! Two huge blasts rip right through the wall next to Easy's head, and he scrambles to the side of the house, underneath another window with the shade pulled down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Shariff) Who the hell's out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting frantic) I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you, Easy? (SILENCE) Tell us what you want, buddy.   See what we can work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy HEARS footsteps coming alongside the house where he been moments ago. KABLAAM! BLAAM! Albright has fired from the inside again, thinking it's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Mouse?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But it's Manny, clutching his throat, gurgling for air, stumbling aimlessly off down the hill. A walking dead man... EASY hears him tumble into some shrubbery and afte moment the gurgling stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy... Hey, Buddy (then to Shariff) Come on, goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne cries out and KLABLANGLE! Easy breaks the window with the gun but KABLAAM! BLAAM! BLAAM! The windowsill tears out above his head and Daphne screams again. Easy looks up to see Shariff, holding her in front of him a shield. He's headed straight for Easy, drawing a bead o him for the kill. And then KABLAAM! the back of Shariff's skull flies off and MOUSE is in the side door, blasting.     BLAAM! Albright breaks for the window. BLAAM! The slug spins him halfway around but he hurls himself through the window backwards. Easy scurries to the front of the house and BLAAM! The bullet goes wide and Albright manages to get into his car and returns fire. BLAAM! BLAAM!... Easy hits the deck. Albright's engine roars to life and he SQUEALS out on the gravel. Mouse appears on the other side of the house and CLICK! CLICK! he's out of ammo. He pulls out the other pistol, but it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, damn, damn! I hit him!     I hit him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy gets up from the ground and trudges into the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy finds Daphne standing in the middle of the room, her whole body quaking in shock. He takes off his jacket and drapes it around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her top lip is swollen and bloody and she has a dark brui on her cheek... She jerks her head, nodding "yes."

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As he leads her through the doorway, he stops to look bac at Shariff's legs sprawling out on the floor from behind sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads her down the front porch and hears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's blood all over here... I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse gets up from squatting down, grinning, the gold rim of his teeth catching a glint from the light coming throu the door. He looks Daphne over, admiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.   Sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy leads her past, quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse opens the back seat door of the car and Easy sees t there's no one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Joppy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he looks around quickly, seeing JOPPY'S BODY lying off on the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouse shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have time to be tying him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne sees the body too and starts gagging. Easy's face twists into helpless pain and he holds a handkerchief to Daphne's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, man?   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why what? You just said don't shoot him. And I didn't... I choked his ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy helps Daphne into the car and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn Mouse!   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How I'm gonna help you back there foolin' 'round with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was tied up! Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, man. If you didn't want him kilt you shouldn't have left him with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he goes around to the passenger side of the car to ge in. Unlike up at the house this was murder -- the same as it been in Texas with Mouse's stepfather and brother. Tears rage well up in Easy's eyes as he hears the car door clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne sits in the car, her eyes staring straight ahead, still in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few people hurry to board the train, Easy and Mouse amo them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I convinced Mouse to take the two o'clock train to Pomona and to let me handle everything else. He could get a train back to Houston later that morning... He was fine with that but only because he was seven thousand dollars richer. Daphne had gotten the money out of a locker at the YMCA without a word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she was still in shock and couldn't really talk... Maybe too because she had stolen about four times that much from Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, if you think you gonna have trouble with that dude Frank, I can run by and kill him and take that evening train to Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has had enough of Mouse for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   This is for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he pulls out something wrapped up in a brown paper ba from his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cut you in for half 'cause I knew you was too big a fool to take your share from that white girl yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy stares numbly at the package and then takes it. The conductor gets on board and the train starts making those metal on metal sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send my grip to Etta Mae. I'm gonna see if she'll take me back now that I'm flush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps Easy on the shoulder and boards the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here's the keys to Dupree's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses them, and the train starts moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you need somebody to run them streets with ya, gimme a call. You know how to put some money in a nigga's pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he laughs, flashing gold teeth pulling away.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Easy watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I would see him again and I didn't know how I felt about that... 'cause, unlike Mouse, my legs were like rubber... the way they had been in the war the whole two years I was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy sits in his car smoking a cigarette, rubbing his ach chin, looking out at

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE AND CARTER
dialogues.text: standing on the lawn in front of the planetarium. Carter wanders after Daphne, explaining while she paces back and forth in anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could tell how it was gonna go when Carter asked us to meet him at the Observatory instead of at his house... She knew it, too. But she had come this far and she had to play it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Daphne stops abruptly and strides hurriedly bac toward the car. Carter follows behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne!   Daphne, sweetheart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts over, too, but then stops, knowing here's no us

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Easy. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy throws a look over at Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't worry, you can give him the pictures yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she throws them down on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: 132   Easy fires up the engine and pulls away with Daphne looking straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slight twist of her head amounts to a shrug and then tears flow. The sun is coming up over the city below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time I felt that I could fall in love with her, too... I was even wondering if it was starting to happen when I dropped her off at 63rd and Dinker where her brother, Frank, was waiting... Then it occurred to me that she still had Carter's money... and I felt like a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy walks onto the rotunda holding a hand to his aching kidney. A secretary comes out to meet him and as she leaves, Todd Carter and a group of men in business suits converge on him, shaking hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evidently Carter had told all his cronies about the pictures because they were all smiles and handshakes and "how do ya do"... The Mayor, the police chief... The newspaper; land developers. All the men who ran the City, and who really stood to gain by who was the Mayor for the next six years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group fans out leaving Carter and Easy alone to walk down a hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spacious and heavy in leather and wood with a not-so- spectacular view of the mountains. It's cold and official like the job itself. Carter pulls a brown envelope from inside his coat pocket not unlike Albright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the remaining eight hundred that I owe you... in cash... And another thousand which I hope will keep this whole thing... you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy nods a tentative "sure."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And I've taken care of your problems with the police. You'll have no more trouble there. And that's a promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy nods and starts to go, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to Easy) Mr. Rawlins... did Daphne ever say... she loved me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy shrugs, not knowing how to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it really matter if she did, Mr. Carter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter nods sadly and Easy walks away leaving him a lonel figure amidst all his power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy holds his kidney and lowers himself gingerly down th granite steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd been thinking about Daphne, too... wondering if she meant what she said about what could have happened between us... But at the moment I was wondering if there was any such thing as a sprained chin. But other than that and a headache, a loose tooth and a kidney that a doctor would need to look at, I felt like five thousand, three hundred dollars... And unless Albright was alive somewhere, that feelin' was gonna last a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ezekiel.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Miller and Mason are waiting outside their car at the cur They come over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got some mighty powerful friends up there... mighty powerful. But, see, we got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy listens disinterestedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) With the Chief sealing these things up like this, it doesn't do much for the morale of the men who've been working on these cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Makes 'em feel like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a guy who's been callin' on the phone. And we're pretty sure that he was up there with McGee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A... uh... colored guy... sounds kinda dumb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting) Not very bright... But he said you accused him of the murder. And he swears you were up there, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, he's out and out pointing the finger at ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd do it to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy waits to make sure they're finished, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, fellas. But I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Why don't you go back to the station and, uh... wait around for my call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch... You watch yourself, you hear! Don't you even spit on the fucking sidewalk... I better not even--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason's voice fades under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be the last moment of my adult life spent free was walking away from City Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEWSPAPER HEADLINE reads: "Carter Back In Race." The subheading reads: "Quiet Civic Leader Returns As Flamboyant Teran Quits."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paper treated the mysterious flip-flop like it happened every day. And I could tell that Matthew Teran wouldn't spend a day in jail... Back in the second section of the paper was a small article about an unidentified man found dead, slumped over the steering wheel of a white Cadillac just north of Malibu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FURTHER BACK, we see that Odell is reading the newspaper, nursing a can of ale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It scared me to think about a world that could kill a man like DeWitt Albright... What could a world like that do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Easy, where's your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy looks up from pulling weeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shop... I'm havin' it fixed up a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Man can't get no decent job in this town without a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot.   I ain't studyin' no job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't thinkin' 'bout no job?   How you gonna live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go to work for myself. Take a little money I got saved up and go into real estate... Start fixin' up folks' gardens again... and do a few favors on the side... Favors for friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you talkin' 'bout, 'favors'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, like a woman offered me thirty dollars to go track down her husband for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talkin' about private investigatin' or somethin'... You could get in trouble doin' that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy keeps working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a man once said to me, Odell: 'Walk out your door in the morning and you're already in trouble'... It's just how you're mixed up in that trouble that counts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy gets up and turns on the water hose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Odell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you got a friend that does bad and you still keep him as your friend, even though you know what he's like... Do you think that's right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you got is your friends, Easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy starts to nod, but then spots

dialogues.speaker: THE WOODCUTTER
dialogues.text: hovering over a rosebush in a neighbor's yard across the street, his shears ready to cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Get out of that yard! (to Odell) Bastard cut down two of my trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy picks up a rock and sails it. Odell comes off the porch and does the same. Then a neighbor from across the street joins in. THE WOODCUTTER ambles off toward another block, leaving Easy, Odell and the neighbor gathered in the middle of th street.

dialogues.speaker: UP THE BLOCK
dialogues.text: a man with a pony is setting up a camera. A few children have gathered, and more are running over from other parts the neighborhood. The man props up a hand-painted sign, "Cowboy Pictures -- Cents," and lifts the first customer onto the pony positioning a cowboy hat on the child's head.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Another neighbor joins Easy and company, and they continu to laugh and talk, looking up from time to time to wave a friends in passing cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought about what Odell had said about friends and it made sense to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odell goes to church every Sunday, so he would know... Later on, he challenged me to a game of dominoes. And what'd he do that for? We got to talkin' 'bout Texas and fooled around and drunk almost a quart of whiskey... And I forgot about Daphne Monet, DeWitt Albright and Carter and them... And sat with my friend, on my porch at my house... and we laughed a long time...
